items.content_html:
A meta-anthology, as I define it, is just like any other anthology. There is a central theme. The addition is that the character, or characters, of each story is the same abstraction. The character is living experiences through different timelines or reincarnations.

I recently messed up my life again. This time at least I forgave myself right away.

In the process, I came up with Maga. I thought that perhaps I can write about things I have learnt from others, especially the women in my life.

Maga then becomes this abstraction or crystal. I came up with 8 different stories or manifestations of Maga. 

I plan to finish this meta-anthology today, however, I have vacations coming which I mostly will spend them on painting my house but I figure perhaps I can write the pending stories in breaks.

Here's the current status.

A wave is a disturbance or oscillation that transfers energy from one point to another. If we are talking about the building blocks of reality, these pieces of energy can behave like particles or waves. 
    But the waves or echoes you are about to read, dear reader, cannot be rationalized. There is no math to explain them. The only way to understand them is by experiencing them.

items.title: [teteo] a god child
items.summary: Before Atlas, I have this story a young god. It came to me when I was nomad-working in Oaxaca. During my stay, I took a niños santos trip. The trip itself was amazing. What blew my mind was the two lights over the sky and the…
items.content_html:
Before Atlas, I have this story a young god. It came to me when I was nomad-working in Oaxaca. During my stay, I took a niños santos trip. The trip itself was amazing. What blew my mind was the two lights over the sky and the beings that visited us.

Actually, it was two stories. One was an ancient gazette in the times of the Aztec Empire. It was a comic about the lives of women during the empire. The inspiration came when I saw a lot of women in the spiritual trip, suffering. The issue was mostly, us, men. That project is still on hold. I'm waiting for the right moment to start it. 

The other project was Teteo. It's about a child who becomes a god by the teaching of her 'Ama. After watching those women, I sort of came to the conclusion that us men are not men. Not to blame anyone but nowadays there is no men initiation: to face death and  become one with your tribe. 

I happen to believe the initiation is necessary to become a better man for yourself and the community. With such technological advancement, I don't see any progress in that. 

I was lucky enough to face death and learnt from it at an early age and also to go to therapy and even so I made a lot of mistakes and caused a lot of suffering to my female companions.

Teteo is a story of how a child becomes a god through the process of balancing his archetypes: King, Warrior, Magician and Lover. The final lesson is her 'Ama's death.

Teteo now is over when it comes to writing. All I need is the illustration.

items.title: [crystal.children] sand
items.summary: One of the main reasons for Crystal Children game is exploration. I've got inspiration from games like Journey and Planet of Lana. I want the user to experience the Desert as Atlas felt it. It's been a long time since I played with Blender. I…
items.content_html:
One of the main reasons for Crystal Children game is exploration. I've got inspiration from games like Journey and Planet of Lana. I want the user to experience the Desert as Atlas felt it.

I

t's been a long time since I played with Blender. I have used Maya and 3DMax in my younger years but I recall nothing. I stayed with Blender because I believe in open source and it's a fantastic tool for 3D purposes.

In my wildest dream, I want the player to be able to surf on high dunes and also at night.

I remember an experience I had in my camping days. It was almost sunset and I needed to set up my camping. I spent more time than I needed in finding a place because the dunes were so precious. I ended up settling in a valley surrounded by dunes 😊😊😊

The solitude was great but the sea and the high dunes added a bonus of nostalgia as If I came from a desert planet or something.

Atlas, however, experienced a desperate and forced solitude. Not only that, it was just a kid finding her way on a desert planet. How will I manage to do that... I wonder.

These samples are more like for display. I have no idea how I'm going to integrate that as the landscape in the game.

items.title: [viatorem] no.XIX
items.summary: While writing Viatorem, I noticed that I was still hyper-hyped with OÜ, the language I will use across the stories of my Cosmos. I found OÜ... as I needed to remember it. And suddenly, when I sat down to type more about Viatorem story I started…
items.content_html:
While writing Viatorem, I noticed that I was still hyper-hyped with OÜ, the language I will use across the stories of my Cosmos. I found OÜ... as I needed to remember it. And suddenly, when I sat down to type more about Viatorem story I started to have this vision of the AI that Viatorem's spaceship will have. One thing led to another and I ended up coding a tiny engine that uses quantum randomness to do a tarot draw. I called KOIMON.

In the beginning, the name started to be a tribute to  koimoons but then everything started to fit without any effort. I needed a fictional AI that would be a companion to Viatorem on her travels. I also wanted that such AI has an intimate knowledge of the spaceship like it was the spaceship itself. The final touch I wanted to add was that I needed the spaceship to have a sort of hardware/software engine that tunes itself in the fabric of the Cosmos and provides information to Viatorem, like an oracle. Then, the name KOIMON came to mind

Japanese "Koi" (鯉) – The koi fish symbolizes perseverance, transformation, and destiny.
In mythology, koi swim upstream and become dragons—perfect for a being that evolves and awakens.

Destiny. Exactly what I was looking for 😍😍😍

Knowledge
Operating
Interface
MONitor

After that, I started to get this visions:

  • What if KOIMON is a system that taps into quantum randomness to gather information that is codified?
  • What if we integrate mystical stuff into the story like the tarot?

I started to remember the Global Consciousness Project and then Randonautica. So I said

  • Wait a second, what if I use a Quantum Random Number Generator for my own experiments?
  • I can map the numbers to a prime number and then a prime number represents a tarot card!
  • What if KOIMON is an interface that provides intimate knowledge of what could be through a tarot reading!?
  • HOLD ON... I can actually do that! Not just for the story BUT actually code the engine!!!!! 🤯🤯🤯

Lo and behold, an hour later I had KOIMON. I tested it out with my own questions. I asked one of my closest friend to test it out and it dogdamned work!!

Yesterday was a crazy day... I felt I was living my own story...

am I becoming Viatorem!?

And finally, the name of the spaceship is no.XIX

items.content_html:
A white thinned spiral emerges from a black triangle pulsing red, and slowly turns into lines that drift upward and fade into a blue field.

What this could feel like:

Birth from pain → rising confusion → cosmic connection

It could symbolize Atlas’s awakening after a traumatic event.

It’s not about translating it. It’s about inviting a state of being.

items.title: [salta.studio] OÜ
items.summary: One of things I enjoy the most is connecting my stories under the same Cosmos. One may think the stories might take place in a different universe but in fact it is all under the same Cosmos. I was looking for a dimension to unify…
items.content_html:
One of things I enjoy the most is connecting my stories under the same Cosmos. One may think the stories might take place in a different universe but in fact it is all under the same Cosmos. I was looking for a dimension to unify them all. Then it dawned on me: language.

Core Principles of the Cosmological Visual Language: OÜ

OÜ cannot be taught. It must be remembered.
Its true form changes depending on who you are when you try to read or write it.

Resonance Over Precision

  • Each symbol doesn’t have a fixed meaning
  • It evokes a feeling, memory, or energy
  • Observants don’t translate it — they attune to it

Since I think reality is a relation, it makes sense that everything since filters out by the being in question. It won't be precise but it would be close enough to full communication which I believe is impossible.

Contextual Shifting

  • Symbols change meaning depending on what’s around them

  • Like in dreams: the same shape means different things depending on time, color, proximity and being's history

Synesthetic Logic

  • Meanings are tied to senses and sensations, not categories:
    • Spirals may feel like warmth or expansion
    • Jagged forms could induce discomfort or transformation
    • Color shifts might signal emotional states or time passage
    • Textures could indicate truth, lies, memories, or hidden layers (???)

Manifestation | Form

Geometry Essence Possible Feelings
Circle Unity, Eternity Safety, Wholeness, Return
Triangle Direction, Growth Drive, Danger, Ambition
Spiral Evolution, Inward Mystery, Transformation, Memory
Square Stability, Structure Order, Rules, Resistance
Line Movement, Connection Flow, Tension, Path

These are not words, they’re experiences.

Manifestation | Color

Color doesn’t just reflect mood — it vibrates in the visual field:

Color Emotional Frequency Use in Visual Language
Red Passion, Violence Inner Conflict, Power, Initiation
Blue Depth, Unknown Dreams, Silence, Cosmic Presence
Yellow Curiosity, Warning Childlike Wonder, Boundary
Green Growth, Patience Healing, Waiting, Transition
Black Absence, Potential Unseen Forces, Void, Mystery
White Light, Beginning Awakening, Forgetting, Peace

I can use gradients or pulses to indicate emotional intensity or time. I find this interesting in the context of Color Theory. Red + Green equals Yellow, do the math 😏😏😏

When drawing, do not think. Feel. It's almost like a dance with your hand - a language drawn from within.

items.title: [salta.studio] shun your artistic self
items.summary: Part of my journey as a human being on this planet was to learn that that my artistic self was shunned during my childhood. It's easier to be cynical about it but in retrospective I don't blame my parents, they were too young to know…
items.content_html:
Part of my journey as a human being on this planet was to learn that that my artistic self was shunned during my childhood. It's easier to be cynical about it but in retrospective I don't blame my parents, they were too young to know what to do. Does anyone of any change know what to do to be a good parent?

I was a sensible kid. Very sensible kid. There were times were I cried and crouched like a baby because of the pain. I don't think it was a physical pain but for some reason that's how my body reacted. I was not an effeminate kid but I was quite sensible. My dad noticed that. In his defense, he saw a kid who clearly would be eaten by the world. So he did he thought best. He tried to make me a man in ways that clearly didn't work. It only made me feel a shame of myself. I wanted to learn to dance like a ballerina. My great grand mother was a famous ballerina in the early 1900s. She travelled the world and such and such. But for a kid to do that and knowing what I was, he, well, didn't allowed that. 

The years past. Only my grand mother let me be. I grew as a kid who couldn't be himself for most of time among other issue. 

I tried to draw and that was alright. I did for years. But something inside me was dying. It's been hmm more than a decade since I haven't drawn anything. During college I made music. Not fancy music but good enough for me. 

I remember that at some point I gave a friend a gift. I wrapped it up with my last drawings. To me they were normal. But for him, he found them fascinating. He framed one of the drawings. It is as we speak hanging in his apartment. I never thought my art would be part of personal art gallery of anybody 🥺🥺🥺

Around those years I tried to make a studio but clearly I failed since I knew shit of managing, leadership or anything. I just wanted a place to create my stuff. Since then I stopped being artistic in any way. No music, no drawings, no dancing.

I honestly don't know what happened inside me. I tried for a second time to create a sort of a studio but more flexible and such. But the issues the economy (and someone else), I run out of money.

Recently, I have a video call with a friend who happens to also be writing children books. After that talk I felt I needed to go back to my roots. There are other major reasons but, for respect to the person involved, I can't say more.

I'm not saying I was good at anything. I'm merely saying that I had something in me that allow to draw, dance and make music and it got lost. I lost it. I blame no one.

Anyway, I'm back. I've been doodling daily. I need to go back. This time, though, I 'm aiming high: I want to find a way to illustrate as far as I can get close to the lord and master Moebiüs style. I need that for my projects. Obviously, I don't want to be like him or draw like him but similar beautiful landscape with my own style.

I have no idea how what I will accomplish. I'm certainly crazy in wanting my projects to succeed when I'm mostly alone and rusty skills but hey the impossibility of things has never been an impediment for moi.

items.title: [viatorem] self-fulfilling prophecy
items.summary: Ain't consider myself an expert on anything. I'm more like an observant, a very curious person. I'm not interested in being judgemental but rather know more about anything. When it comes to writing or any creative process, my way to go is to be surrounded…
items.content_html:
Ain't consider myself an expert on anything. I'm more like an observant, a very curious person. I'm not interested in being judgemental but rather know more about anything. When it comes to writing or any creative process, my way to go is to be surrounded by things that project you into those scenarios.

I just realized that I have become, in a way, Viatorem. I think that's why I fell in love with that character. I'm in my house at 6am working with Lola, a tiny bunny. I recently pierced my ears again and the design I chose is like a representation of hey eyes. I started to see my home as a spaceship. In the afternoons, I take a break and start dancing in the open space I have. Viatorem's adventure will always start with a song and her dancing in her spaceship. I'm living in a desert city and I love the desert.

I have in front of me, for lack of a better word, a self-fulfilling prophecy. I mean, I intentionally but also subconsciously did it.

What I find very interesting is that Viatorem was not my creation. She was created by koimoons. Now I find myself not being able to live without her. Don't get me wrong. I love Atlas' story. I created her. She's in my room as we speak but Viatorem seems to fulfill a very old dream: to travel the Cosmos and have space adventures, my own personal space opera.

I'm grateful for what my life has become especially with this forsaken global situation.

✨✨✨
🌌🌌🌌

items.title: [salta.studio] about immortality
items.summary: I touch many subjects in my stories. Some of my friends are surprised by the subjects I choose to write about. As an example, I'm utterly and completely terrified about immortality. While I write stories, either in my head or on paper, most of the ideas…
items.content_html:
I touch many subjects in my stories. Some of my friends are surprised by the subjects I choose to write about. As an example, I'm utterly and completely terrified about immortality.

While I write stories, either in my head or on paper, most of the ideas are sad but profound subjects when it comes to human existence. From time to time, I add happy moments, just like life. 

Like any artistic person, I, for one, believe during the process of creating, more ideas get downloaded. Recently, I came up with a tiny little story in the form of a rhyme. This is clearly a projection of my fear. I don't think immortality is a good idea. So I imagine we have a choice. The following is a possible scenario in the form of rhymed storytelling, if you will

The Simple But Sad Story of Mr. Feinberg

Mr. Feinberg, you learned it true
Immortality stays—consciousness grew
Yet love once cherished passed away
And none remain to light your way

Mr. Feinberg, what will you do?
She drifts where stars shine cold and blue
The Cosmos swells, it pulls apart
No matter time, no bridge to heart

Yes, Mr. Feinberg, you may choose
To let it end, to cut it loose
Yes, Mr. Feinberg, pain won't fade
Eternal life—a cruel charade

A final mezcal, a sunset’s glow
A whisper soft, a last shadow
Mr. Feinberg, you cease to be
No longer bound to memory

Here lies the tale, somber and deep
A man whose love refused to sleep
Even in death, it held on tight
A love that burned beyond the night

Rest in peace, dear friend so true
Immortality was bittersweet with you

 

PS: I'm retaking drawing daily now, I hope soon add some images to these posts 🤞🏻🤞🏻🤞🏻

items.title: [salta.studio] tarot
items.summary: I used the tarot. There is no point on denying that. And, to my luck, it has been so helpful and terrifying. In 3 reading sessions, my interpretation, it was that there will be someone in the future that will help me be accountable, supportive…
items.content_html:
I used the tarot. There is no point on denying that. And, to my luck, it has been so helpful and terrifying.

In 3 reading sessions, my interpretation, it was that there will be someone in the future that will help me be accountable, supportive but not in a collaborative way. 

I didn't understand those readings. It asked me to be patience, that it will come.

Those reading happened after, koimoons, the illustrator, so I knew it wasn't her.

Why is that impressive? Well, it also said that it will be someone from my past 😨😨😨

At those moments, I could thought of anyone.

Weeks past, and nothing. But I needed to be patience, it said or rather I understood that.

Yesterday, finally, I have a casual meeting with a friend. He's living in Brooklyn now. He is one of those artistic people I admire so much. I don't know why I didn't think of him before. In my defense, I think I didn't think of him 'cuz he's always doing something artistic plus work. Internally, I guess I knew he wouldn't have the time.

Lo and behold, we now have every Sunday meeting of what we called Creative Anonymous Support Group. He is also writing children books!

😳😳😳
🤯🤯🤯

PS: I'm so happy for this support. I really needed. It's like traveling the Cosmos totally alone and it feels nice that through intercom there is something in the Cosmos doing something similar.
